meanings.definition: A person or thing that corrects or rectifies something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is a helpful corrector of mistakes in our homework.
meanings.sent2: I always rely on my spell-checker, a useful corrector, to fix my spelling errors.
meanings.sent3: The friendly corrector, the class clown, playfully pointed out the error in the math problem.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a soothing corrector, smoothing over any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The diligent corrector diligently worked to fix the errors in the report.

meanings.definition: A substance used to correct or neutralize acidity or alkalinity.
meanings.sent1: Lemon juice can be a natural corrector to balance the sourness in a dish.
meanings.sent2: Baking soda is a common corrector to reduce acidity in recipes.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected addition of vinegar, a usual corrector, made the soup taste strange.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a sweet corrector, adding a touch of brightness to the room.
meanings.sent5: The chemical corrector effectively balanced the pH levels in the water tank.

meanings.definition: A device used to correct errors in writing or printing.
meanings.sent1: The eraser on a pencil is a handy corrector for mistakes on paper.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a white-out corrector nearby when typing on the computer.
meanings.sent3: The robotic corrector, a quirky invention, automatically fixed typos in the document.
meanings.sent4: Her red pen was a strict corrector, marking all the errors in the essay.
meanings.sent5: The electronic corrector quickly identified and corrected the spelling mistakes in the text.
